metadata.title: YouTube End Screen Tips 2025: Keep Viewers Watching
metadata.description: Optimize YouTube end screens. Convert viewers into subscribers and keep them watching.

hero.headline: YouTube End Screen Tips
hero.subheadline: Capture viewers before they leave. Convert and keep watching.

sections.content: End screens appear in the last 5-20 seconds of your video, offering clickable elements to keep viewers in your ecosystem. Without end screens, viewers leave—with them, they subscribe, watch more, or visit external sites. Proper end screen strategy extends watch sessions and grows your channel.

faq.question: How long should end screens be?
faq.answer: 15-20 seconds is optimal. Minimum 5 seconds required. Longer than 20 seconds feels like filler. Design your outro to naturally fit end screen duration.

faq.question: Best for viewer or specific video?
faq.answer: 'Best for viewer' lets algorithm choose based on individual viewer behavior—often performs well. Specific video if you want strategic traffic. Test both and check Analytics.

faq.question: Should I always include subscribe button?
faq.answer: Generally yes—every video is subscribe opportunity. But prioritize keeping them watching. Video element usually more valuable than subscribe if choosing only one.

faq.question: Why aren't people clicking end screens?
faq.answer: Common issues: not verbally calling attention to them, elements not visible against background, viewers leaving before end screen, not relevant video suggestions. Check where retention drops off.
